commit_message:
Add spec for multiple protocols share

In order to let a customer can operate the same data from diffenrent
operating system. There has two methods to implement this feature.
This spec is the first draft, just use it for discussion.
Welcome to review.

Change-Id: I2025738095238b8641e9bc1f06c9eb57ccedd53a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/manila-specs refs/changes/80/446280/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ======================= Multiple protocol share ======================= Blueprint: https://blueprints.launchpad.net/manila/+spec/share-backup Currently, A share doesn't support multiple protocol at the same time in Manila. This blueprint is for work to make this possible. Problem description =================== Use Cases ========= A customer want to use one share in his linux system, and also use same share in his windows system or something else. The customer can operate the same share data from diffenrent systems. Proposed change =============== Method 1: In order to let a customer can operate the same data from diffenrent operating system. We could let a share have multiple protocols. The following changes will happen: - Shares will span multiple protocols, These protocols would be associated with one access. - Add the APIs for adding/removing protocols to a share. If the share have only one protocol, the protocol can not be removed. - The type driver's ``storage_protocol`` capabilitiy is modified from the string to list. - Add the option protocol parameter in allow/deny access API. If user allow/deny access with no protocol, the access will be added/removed to all of the protocol in a share. Otherwise user need to specify the share protocol. - Enhance the scheculer for ``storage_protocol`` capabilitiy. Not changes: - A share would still only be associated with one share instance. Method 2: In order to let a customer can operate the same data from diffenrent operating system. We could let multiple shares corresponding to one share instance, and thoes shares with diffenrent protocols. The following changes will happen: - Share instances will span multiple shares, and add a flag to mark thoes shares are stored in the same place. User can modify the same data from diffenrent protocol shares. - Each share instance can not support no more than one protocol. - If a share instance not only associated with a share, the share instance can not be deleted. - Add a parameter named ``associate_share`` in create share command. We can use this to create a new share with ``associate_share`` id. The new share instance is as the same as the ``associate_share`` instance. It can not support input the ``associate_share`` id and the share_type at the same time. - The driver API implement will be changed. In create share API, add a new parameter named ``associate_share``. The default value is None. Not changes: - Allow/deny access to a share command is not changed. - Create snapshot command is not changed. Alternatives ------------ None Data model impact ----------------- Method 1: The ``manila.db.sqlalchemy.models.Share`` model will no longer contain the specific information: ``share_proto``. These keys will be part of a new model ``manila.db.sqlalchemy.models.ShareProtocol`` which has a primary key: ``id`` and ``share_id``, ``protocol_type``. A share protocol is only associated with exactly one share. DESC share_protocol_map; +---------------+-------------+------+-----+---------+-------+ | Field | Type | Null | Key | Default | Extra | +---------------+-------------+------+-----+---------+-------+ | created_at | datetime | YES | | NULL | | | updated_at | datetime | YES | | NULL | | | deleted_at | datetime | YES | | NULL | | | deleted | varchar(36) | YES | | NULL | | | id | varchar(36) | NO | PRI | NULL | | | share_id | varchar(36) | YES | MUL | NULL | | | protocol_type | varchar(36) | YES | MUL | NULL | | +---------------+-------------+------+-----+---------+-------+ Remove ``share_proto`` from ``manila.db.sqlalchemy.models.Share`` model DESC shares; +-----------------------------+--------------+------+-----+---------+-------+ | Field | Type | Null | Key | Default | Extra | +-----------------------------+--------------+------+-----+---------+-------+ | created_at | datetime | YES | | NULL | | | updated_at | datetime | YES | | NULL | | | deleted_at | datetime | YES | | NULL | | | deleted | varchar(36) | YES | | NULL | | | id | varchar(36) | NO | PRI | NULL | | | user_id | varchar(255) | YES | | NULL | | | project_id | varchar(255) | YES | | NULL | | | size | int(11) | YES | | NULL | | | display_name | varchar(255) | YES | | NULL | | | display_description | varchar(255) | YES | | NULL | | | snapshot_id | varchar(36) | YES | | NULL | | | share_type_id | varchar(36) | YES | | NULL | | | is_public | tinyint(1) | YES | | NULL | | | snapshot_support | tinyint(1) | YES | | NULL | | | consistency_group_id | varchar(36) | YES | MUL | NULL | | | source_cgsnapshot_member_id | varchar(36) | YES | | NULL | | | task_state | varchar(255) | YES | | NULL | | | replication_type | varchar(255) | YES | | NULL | | +-----------------------------+--------------+------+-----+---------+-------+ The ``manila.db.sqlalchemy.models.ShareAccessMapping`` model will add the specific information: ``protocol_id``. If you allow access with no protocol, the access will be added to all of the protocol in a share. DESC share_access_map; +--------------+--------------+------+-----+---------+-------+ | Field | Type | Null | Key | Default | Extra | +--------------+--------------+------+-----+---------+-------+ | created_at | datetime | YES | | NULL | | | updated_at | datetime | YES | | NULL | | | deleted_at | datetime | YES | | NULL | | | deleted | varchar(36) | YES | | NULL | | | id | varchar(36) | NO | PRI | NULL | | | share_id | varchar(36) | NO | MUL | NULL | | | protocol_id | varchar(36) | NO | MUL | NULL | | | access_type | varchar(255) | YES | | NULL | | | access_to | varchar(255) | YES | | NULL | | | access_level | varchar(2) | YES | | NULL | | +--------------+--------------+------+-----+---------+-------+ Method 2: The ``manila.db.sqlalchemy.models.Share`` model will add a new key: ``associate_share``. It could be set to true or false. DESC shares; +-----------------------------+--------------+------+-----+---------+-------+ | Field | Type | Null | Key | Default | Extra | +-----------------------------+--------------+------+-----+---------+-------+ | associate_share | varchar(36) | YES | | NULL | | | created_at | datetime | YES | | NULL | | | updated_at | datetime | YES | | NULL | | | deleted_at | datetime | YES | | NULL | | | deleted | varchar(36) | YES | | NULL | | | id | varchar(36) | NO | PRI | NULL | | | user_id | varchar(255) | YES | | NULL | | | project_id | varchar(255) | YES | | NULL | | | size | int(11) | YES | | NULL | | | display_name | varchar(255) | YES | | NULL | | | display_description | varchar(255) | YES | | NULL | | | snapshot_id | varchar(36) | YES | | NULL | | | share_type_id | varchar(36) | YES | | NULL | | | protocol_type | varchar(36) | YES | MUL | NULL | | | is_public | tinyint(1) | YES | | NULL | | | snapshot_support | tinyint(1) | YES | | NULL | | | consistency_group_id | varchar(36) | YES | MUL | NULL | | | source_cgsnapshot_member_id | varchar(36) | YES | | NULL | | | task_state | varchar(255) | YES | | NULL | | | replication_type | varchar(255) | YES | | NULL | | +-----------------------------+--------------+------+-----+---------+-------+ REST API impact --------------- Method 1: **Adding a protocol to a share**:: POST /v2/?{tenant_id}?/shares/?{share_id}?/action Request:: { "share_protocol" : { "protocol_type": "NFS", } } The protocol_type is required parameter. If ``protocol_type`` is None, the API will respond with ``400 Bad Request``. **Removing a protocol from a share**:: DELETE /v2/?{tenant_id}?/shares/?{share_id}?/protocol/{share-protocol-id} If the share ID or the share protocol ID is invalid, the API will respond with ``404 NotFound``. If there is a access on the share protocol, it cannot be removed; the API will respond with ``409 Conflict``. **Grants access to a share**:: POST /v2/?{tenant_id}?/shares/?{share_id}?/action Request:: { "allow_access": { "access_level": "rw", "access_type": "ip", "access_to": "0.0.0.0/0", "access_protocol": "NFS" } } The ``access_protocol`` is optional. If ``access_protocol`` is not input from user, it will grants access to all of the protocol in a share. If the ``access_protocol`` is not support to driver, the API will respond with ``400 Bad Request``. **Revokes access from a share**:: POST /v2/?{tenant_id}?/shares/?{share_id}?/action Request:: { "deny_access": { "access_protocol": "NFS" "access_id": "a25b2df3-90bd-4add-afa6-5f0dbbd50452" } } The ``access_protocol`` is optional. If ``access_protocol`` is not input from user, it will Revokes access to all of the protocol in a share. If the ``access_protocol`` is not support to driver, the API will respond with ``400 Bad Request``. Method 2: **Modify create share**:: POST /v2/?{tenant_id}?/shares Request:: { "share": { "associate_share": "sd97c191-8427-4661-a2e8-b23820dc01d4", "description": "My custom share London", "share_type": null, "share_proto": "nfs", "share_network_id": "713df749-aac0-4a54-af52-10f6c991e80c", "name": "share_London", "consistency_group_id": "9397c191-8427-4661-a2e8-b23820dc01d4", "snapshot_id": null, "is_public": true, "size": 1, "metadata": { "project": "my_app", "aim": "doc" } } } Add ``associate_share`` in create share API, the associate_share is option parameter. Driver impact ------------- Security impact --------------- None Notifications impact -------------------- None Other end user impact --------------------- Performance Impact ------------------ None Other deployer impact --------------------- Developer impact ---------------- Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: zhongjun Work Items ---------- * Implement core feature * Implement tempest support * Implement manila-ui support Dependencies ============ None Testing ======= * Standard unit tests. * Tempest tests. Documentation Impact ==================== - Docstrings. - Devref. - Security guide. - User guide. - Release notes. References ========== None

commit_message:
Deploy NTP with puppet-tripleo profile

Deploy NTP by using puppet-tripleo profile, so we can re-use the bits on
the undercloud.

Closes-Bug: #1665426

Change-Id: I8c13fbc9267ff28065f0de97424a4eac78c370fb

commit_message:
[user guides] Change nova filenames to reference os commands

This patch adjusts filenames to remove the word `nova`, which
suggests users will run nova commands. Instead, adding `os`
indicates users will run OpenStack commands.

The patch also includes minor adjustments to wording, and
section references.

Change-Id: I04a96d982a404bdaf94ecfcfa7c0ef1205106ed0
Closes-Bug: #1666294

commit_message:
Remove reference to Cinder v1 client

extensions_client of Cinder is set based on the enabled API.
So it is not necessary to set the v1 client as the default.

Change-Id: I9efc06615d166853d9da42a55feeb46d19f50cbd

commit_message:
Add specific dates for Pike schedule

Some placeholders were left over in the comments for the Pike
milestones. This updates them now that we know the specific weeks for
each one.

Change-Id: I1e39a46796b3f3045e9e61f28716ca6551644772

commit_message:
Add additional param to policy.RuleDefault

This patch adds the needed subclass to define policy objects
that now require the description and operations parameters.

The operations parameter when defining a policy rule should follow
the below format.
    - operations : list of dicts containing the api url and verb.
        Ex : operations=[{path='/some/url/', method='GET'}]

This change make sure operators have all the information needed
in a centralized location in order to make decisions and understand
the purpose of a certain policy.

Change-Id: Ie9b335420394166bb39c43e3d26fcc9237ffd1a0
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo.policy refs/changes/70/439070/10 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: :parm verb: The desired api verb to be performed for a given request. :parm url: The url of the api call. :parm scope: The defined scope of the policy. :parm access: The rule access permission. This is used to determine to perform either read or write. def __init__(self, name, check_str, description=None, verb=None, url=None, scope=None, access=None): self.verb = verb self.url = url self.scope = scope self.access = access

commit_message:
Indicating the location tests directory in oslo_debug_helper

According to [1], we can passing a "-t" argument to
oslo_debug_helper to indicate the directory where tests
are located. This will solves ImportError exception.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslotest/features.html

Change-Id: Ia8a31b506517c18bc95fbda51c9941b53b26d479
Closes-Bug: #1666560
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/70/443470/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: commands = oslo_debug_helper -t heat/tests {posargs}

commit_message:
Adds snapshot_image_format configuration

Some filesystems deal better with snapshots in a particular
format to handle deduplication and cloning. This adds support
for configuring this.

Change-Id: Ic3027ac4bb89e8d596a92ba0d517f80a69c65214
Implements: add_snapshot_image_format
Closes-Bug: #1671575
(cherry picked from commit 630ebbc87472d0240f28b628d77bbcb96711449c)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-nova refs/changes/95/445895/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # [*libvirt_snapshot_image_format*] # (optional) Format to save snapshots to. Some filesystems # have a preference and only operate on raw or qcow2 # Defaults to $::os_service_default # $libvirt_snapshot_image_format = $::os_service_default, 'DEFAULT/compute_driver': value => $compute_driver; 'DEFAULT/preallocate_images': value => $preallocate_images; 'vnc/vncserver_listen': value => $vncserver_listen; 'libvirt/virt_type': value => $libvirt_virt_type; 'libvirt/cpu_mode': value => $libvirt_cpu_mode_real; 'libvirt/snapshot_image_format': value => $libvirt_snapshot_image_format; 'libvirt/inject_password': value => $libvirt_inject_password; 'libvirt/inject_key': value => $libvirt_inject_key; 'libvirt/inject_partition': value => $libvirt_inject_partition; 'libvirt/hw_disk_discard': value => $libvirt_hw_disk_discard; 'libvirt/hw_machine_type': value => $libvirt_hw_machine_type; 'libvirt/enabled_perf_events': value => $libvirt_enabled_perf_events;
deleted_lines: 'DEFAULT/compute_driver': value => $compute_driver; 'DEFAULT/preallocate_images': value => $preallocate_images; 'vnc/vncserver_listen': value => $vncserver_listen; 'libvirt/virt_type': value => $libvirt_virt_type; 'libvirt/cpu_mode': value => $libvirt_cpu_mode_real; 'libvirt/inject_password': value => $libvirt_inject_password; 'libvirt/inject_key': value => $libvirt_inject_key; 'libvirt/inject_partition': value => $libvirt_inject_partition; 'libvirt/hw_disk_discard': value => $libvirt_hw_disk_discard; 'libvirt/hw_machine_type': value => $libvirt_hw_machine_type; 'libvirt/enabled_perf_events': value => $libvirt_enabled_perf_events;

commit_message:
Add http-check options to haproxy service template

With current implementation, http health checks can handle only default
return codes (2|3)[0-9][0-9]. Added http-check option to template
so that users can specify explicit expect codes or strings if needed.

Change-Id: I6439d27fb4d219d2620cb147eaf3ad16ce758845
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-haproxy_server refs/changes/86/446186/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Add http-check options to haproxy service template

With current implementation, http health checks can handle only default
return codes (2|3)[0-9][0-9]. Added http-check option to template
so that users can specify explicit expect codes or strings if needed.

Change-Id: I6439d27fb4d219d2620cb147eaf3ad16ce758845

subject: devstack: install qemu-kvm on RHEL-based distros
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-15 16:35:59.000000000', 'files': ['devstack/plugin.sh'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/octavia/commit/8aa15008bb3e96282783995f157325ef329fa5be', 'message': 'devstack: install qemu-kvm on RHEL-based distros

On these systems, asking to install qemu will bring in the default OS
older version, which causes problem with nova, for more details:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/438325

Ask for qemu-kvm instead, which should install the proper version

Change-Id: I60eca649ca1ae53c341d68670d4ab1f3559ac31d
Related-Bug: #1668164
'}]
commit_message:
devstack: install qemu-kvm on RHEL-based distros

On these systems, asking to install qemu will bring in the default OS
older version, which causes problem with nova, for more details:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/438325

Ask for qemu-kvm instead, which should install the proper version

Change-Id: I60eca649ca1ae53c341d68670d4ab1f3559ac31d
Related-Bug: #1668164
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/octavia refs/changes/59/446059/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: install_package kpartx if [[ ${DISTRO} =~ "rhel7" ]]; then # Installing qemu would bring in the default OS qemu package, # which is too old for Pike and later releases # See https://review.openstack.org/#/c/438325 for details install_package qemu-kvm else install_package qemu fi

commit_message:
Add test_resize_server_with_not_changing_flavor

Add a negative test to resize server to the same
flavor as original one.

Change-Id: If771aa219bea11eb5b1eab9bbe040835af5ea21a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/91/440191/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: @decorators.idempotent_id('b86b1248-66f8-4ef0-a229-3cb57c125d64') @testtools.skipUnless(CONF.compute_feature_enabled.resize, 'Resize not available.') @test.attr(type=['negative']) def test_resize_server_with_smaller_disk_flavor(self): # Resize a server with smaller_disk flavor flavor = self.flavors_client.show_flavor( CONF.compute.flavor_ref)['flavor'] smaller_flavor = flavor smaller_flavor['disk'] = flavor['disk'] - 1 self.assertRaises(lib_exc.BadRequest, self.client.resize_server, self.server_id, flavor_ref=smaller_flavor)

subject: Modified repo build for better multi-OS support
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-10 18:21:37.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-repo_build/commit/5ccc4eebf3003ff992cda900d7bc5947b441ebb9', 'message': 'Modified repo build for better multi-OS support

The repo build role will now store all wheels and venvs in directories
containg information about the OS in which the bits were build on. The
intention here is to ensure that all installation are able to support
multi-OS without running into issues caused by system packages and
different core libs. This change builds upon the multi-archetecture
support we already have.

Change-Id: I3f36afa307e02a38d73b860fc23ed94a09882c34
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2017-03-14 17:02:29.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-repo_build/commit/edb3c80231b77ecf2fd79d77a3d88393ca29b469', 'message': 'Modified repo build for better multi-OS support

The repo build role will now store all wheels and venvs in directories
containg information about the OS in which the bits were build on. The
intention here is to ensure that all installation are able to support
multi-OS without running into issues caused by system packages and
different core libs. This change builds upon the multi-archetecture
support we already have.

commit_message:
Modified repo build for better multi-OS support

The repo build role will now store all wheels and venvs in directories
containg information about the OS in which the bits were build on. The
intention here is to ensure that all installation are able to support
multi-OS without running into issues caused by system packages and
different core libs. This change builds upon the multi-archetecture
support we already have.

Closes-Bug: 1641131
Change-Id: I3f36afa307e02a38d73b860fc23ed94a09882c34
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Add better support for multi-OS deployments

This change adds a few variables which allow it to consume a repo-server
setup which has releases based on OS and ARCH. The changes require a
deployer to have at least one repo-server per-OS type being deployed.
This means that if a deployer wanted to do a mixed CentOS 7 and Ubuntu
16.04 deployment they'd need at least one repo server in each of OS type
which facilitates the building of wheels for each OS.

Change-Id: Ifd5ff22ae47bc9a2a88c1bbb2632ce48ba5accbf
Closes-Bug: 1641131
Depends-On: I3f36afa307e02a38d73b860fc23ed94a09882c34
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Add support kuryr IPv6 subnet

This patch add IPv6 subnet when calling NetworkDriver.CreateNetwork.

NOTE:
Fullstack test and docs will land in separate patches.

Change-Id: I0721f5896710e221ae028c62e69768b51014d0af
Partially-Implements: blueprint ipv6-subnet
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kuryr-libnetwork refs/changes/94/442294/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: v4_pool_cidr = json_data['IPv4Data'][0]['Pool'] v6_pool_cidr = None if json_data['IPv6Data']: v6_pool_cidr = json_data['IPv6Data'][0]['Pool'] v4_gateway_ip = '' v6_gateway_ip = '' if 'Gateway' in json_data['IPv4Data'][0]: v4_gateway_cidr = json_data['IPv4Data'][0]['Gateway'] v4_gateway_ip = v4_gateway_cidr.split('/')[0] if json_data['IPv6Data'] and 'Gateway' in json_data['IPv6Data'][0]: v6_gateway_cidr = json_data['IPv6Data'][0]['Gateway'] v6_gateway_ip = v6_gateway_cidr.split('/')[0] v4_pool_name = '' v4_pool_id = '' v6_pool_name = '' v6_pool_id = '' v4_pool_name = generic_options.get(const.NEUTRON_POOL_NAME_OPTION) v6_pool_name = generic_options.get( const.NEUTRON_V6_POOL_NAME_OPTION) if not v4_pool_name: v4_pool_name = lib_utils.get_neutron_subnetpool_name(v4_pool_cidr) if not v6_pool_name and v6_pool_cidr: v6_pool_name = lib_utils.get_neutron_subnetpool_name(v6_pool_cidr) v4_pools = _get_subnetpools_by_attrs(name=v4_pool_name) if v4_pools: v4_pool_id = v4_pools[0]['id'] ("Specified v4 pool name({0}) does not " "exist.").format(v4_pool_name)) if v6_pool_name: v6_pools = _get_subnetpools_by_attrs(name=v6_pool_name) if v6_pools: v6_pool_id = v6_pools[0]['id'] else: raise exceptions.KuryrException( ("Specified v6 pool name({0}) does not " "exist.").format(v6_pool_name)) v4_cidr = ipaddress.ip_network(six.text_type(v4_pool_cidr)) v4_subnets = _get_subnets_by_attrs(network_id=network_id, cidr=six.text_type(v4_cidr)) if len(v4_subnets) > 1: "Multiple Neutron v4 subnets exist for the network_id={0}" "and v4_cidr={1}".format(network_id, v4_cidr)) v6_cidr = None v6_subnets = [] if v6_pool_cidr: v6_cidr = ipaddress.ip_network(six.text_type(v6_pool_cidr)) v6_subnets = _get_subnets_by_attrs(network_id=network_id, cidr=six.text_type(v6_cidr)) if len(v6_subnets) > 1: raise exceptions.DuplicatedResourceException( "Multiple Neutron v6 subnets exist for the network_id={0}" "and v6_cidr={1}".format(network_id, v6_cidr)) # for existing Neutron subnets. if app.tag: if len(v4_subnets) == 1: _neutron_subnet_add_tag(v4_subnets[0]['id'], v4_pool_id) if len(v6_subnets) == 1: _neutron_subnet_add_tag(v6_subnets[0]['id'], v6_pool_id) if not v4_subnets: new_v4_subnets = [{ 'name': utils.make_subnet_name(v4_pool_cidr), 'ip_version': v4_cidr.version, 'cidr': six.text_type(v4_cidr), new_v4_subnets[0]['subnetpool_id'] = v4_pool_id if v4_gateway_ip: new_v4_subnets[0]['gateway_ip'] = v4_gateway_ip app.neutron.create_subnet({'subnets': new_v4_subnets}) LOG.debug("Created kuryr v4 subnet %s", new_v4_subnets) if not v6_subnets and v6_pool_cidr: new_v6_subnets = [{ 'name': utils.make_subnet_name(v6_pool_cidr), 'network_id': network_id, 'ip_version': v6_cidr.version, 'cidr': six.text_type(v6_cidr), 'enable_dhcp': app.enable_dhcp, }] new_v6_subnets[0]['subnetpool_id'] = v6_pool_id if v6_gateway_ip: new_v6_subnets[0]['gateway_ip'] = v6_gateway_ip app.neutron.create_subnet({'subnets': new_v6_subnets}) LOG.debug("Created kuryr v6 subnet %s", new_v6_subnets)
deleted_lines: pool_cidr = json_data['IPv4Data'][0]['Pool'] gateway_ip = '' if 'Gateway' in json_data['IPv4Data'][0]: gateway_cidr = json_data['IPv4Data'][0]['Gateway'] gateway_ip = gateway_cidr.split('/')[0] LOG.debug("gateway_cidr %(gateway_cidr)s, " "gateway_ip %(gateway_ip)s", {'gateway_cidr': gateway_cidr, 'gateway_ip': gateway_ip}) pool_name = '' pool_id = '' pool_name = generic_options.get(const.NEUTRON_POOL_NAME_OPTION) if not pool_name: pool_name = lib_utils.get_neutron_subnetpool_name(pool_cidr) pools = _get_subnetpools_by_attrs(name=pool_name) if pools: pool_id = pools[0]['id'] ("Specified pool name({0}) does not " "exist.").format(pool_name)) cidr = ipaddress.ip_network(six.text_type(pool_cidr)) subnets = _get_subnets_by_attrs(network_id=network_id, cidr=six.text_type(cidr)) if len(subnets) > 1: "Multiple Neutron subnets exist for the network_id={0}" "and cidr={1}".format(network_id, cidr)) # for existing Neutron subnet. if app.tag and len(subnets) == 1: _neutron_subnet_add_tag(subnets[0]['id'], pool_id) if not subnets: new_subnets = [{ 'name': utils.make_subnet_name(pool_cidr), 'ip_version': cidr.version, 'cidr': six.text_type(cidr), new_subnets[0]['subnetpool_id'] = pool_id if gateway_ip: new_subnets[0]['gateway_ip'] = gateway_ip app.neutron.create_subnet({'subnets': new_subnets})

commit_message:
Tolerate WebOb===1.7.1

The following tests fail with 1.7.1:
test_microversions_inner_function_v21
test_microversions_inner_function_v22

(Both LegacyMicroversionsTest and MicroversionsTest)

Looks like Webob is being stricter about body (or at least
an empty body) with POST. we get a 400 error with the
following body if we do not sepecify a body
'{"badRequest": {"message": "Malformed request body", "code": 400}}'

Change-Id: I30fbc3dfea2b4be5d46fb2386e71efcd025d277f

subject: Replace yaml.load() with yaml.safe_load()
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-10 08:32:06.000000000', 'files': ['neutronclient/tests/functional/core/test_cli_formatter.py', 'neutronclient/tests/unit/test_cli20.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/python-neutronclient/commit/ed8b67cb4fcf46e447d85a3b759ca900ffdaa057', 'message': 'Replace yaml.load() with yaml.safe_load()

Yaml.load() return Python object may be dangerous if
you receive a YAML document from an untrusted source
such as the Internet. The function yaml.safe_load()
limits this ability to simple Python objects like
integers or lists.

Reference:
https://security.openstack.org/guidelines/dg_avoid-dangerous-input-parsing-libraries.html

Change-Id: Ia7b967e2063375d98eedb38344a0fa79e3f46325
'}]
commit_message:
Replace yaml.load() with yaml.safe_load()

Yaml.load() return Python object may be dangerous if
you receive a YAML document from an untrusted source
such as the Internet. The function yaml.safe_load()
limits this ability to simple Python objects like
integers or lists.

Reference:
https://security.openstack.org/guidelines/dg_avoid-dangerous-input-parsing-libraries.html

Change-Id: Ia7b967e2063375d98eedb38344a0fa79e3f46325

commit_message:
Refactor and enable shell access

When installing from binary, packaging tools create a user for
Keystone which does not have a shell.  This results in fernet
token operations failing due to the fact that `rsync` cannot
connect over SSH because the Keystone user cannot login.

This patch addresses this issue by enabling shell access
to the Keystone user, it also refactors the Nova SSH controller
to use the pre-existing macro.

Change-Id: Ic753a94311c5d7d72a82d91c1279dfe982e9afbd
Related-Bug: #1617902

commit_message:
Allow using different database backends

Abstract storage configuration section to load different database
backend drivers. so we can keep supporting elasticsearch for
a while after moving to oslo.db also this will help in adding
API v2 as the elasticsearch driver will be changed.

Each db driver will register it's configuration on the run time.

Change-Id: Ie861e569f4add783c6f580cd0c08ed0fb3440151

commit_message:
Add bindep support

Bindep is an automation tool used by openstack-infra to bootstrap a
worker with default packages. This is not needed, since we depend on
puppet to automate this step.

Change-Id: Idb3d142536052674f1b38856183f7e2af5065958

commit_message:
Use sphinx warning-is-error

Sphix 1.5 (I9e7261c4124b71eeb6bddd9e21747b61bbdc16fa) includes
"warning-is-error" which supersedes pbr's warnerrors.  Enable this and
fix up the resulting failures

 - trailing lines for lists in element_deps directive
 - missing README's that are linked
 - syntax error and highlighting in building instructions

Change-Id: I6549551b4a9bf47076c9811a7a38a666cbea2a50

commit_message:
Using tpool to execute the time-consuming cmds with rbd backend.

When cinder-volume or cinder-backup use ceph rbd as backend, there
are some cmds or statements are time-consuming, such as full copy
or flatten or backup a very big cinder volume. These opretions may
block the cinder-volume or cinder-backup daemons and turn the 'State'
to down. So using tpool to execute the time-consuming cmds to avoid
this suitation.

Change-Id: I36f27ac1a875de56fd6a31c4c512dc773f4f4ff1
Signed-off-by: lihaijing <lihaijing@fiberhome.com>

commit_message:
Update glance sanity check to use built in shade

The current module 'kolla_sanity' was written as a shim before full
shade support was added to Ansible. This should now no longer be needed,
we can implement the checks using Ansible provided modules.

Partially-implements: blueprint sanity-check-container
Depends-On: If6d10f2ce90c7fc72353566554352b0310942f30
Change-Id: Ie08c952178cdbea6e6a6e9e91cb62090ea98c2be
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla-ansible refs/changes/49/437949/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - name: Glance sanity check - create image kolla_toolbox: module_name: os_image module_args: auth: "{{ openstack_glance_auth }}" name: "glance_sanity_check" filename: "/etc/hostname" delegate_to: "{{ groups['glance-api'][0] }}" when: kolla_enable_sanity_keystone | bool - name: Glance sanity check - cleanup kolla_toolbox: module_name: os_image module_args: auth: "{{ openstack_glance_auth }}" name: "glance_sanity_check" state: absent delegate_to: "{{ groups['glance-api'][0] }}" run_once: True when: kolla_enable_sanity_keystone | bool
deleted_lines: - name: Glance sanity checks command: docker exec -t kolla_toolbox /usr/bin/ansible localhost -m kolla_sanity -a "service=glance project=service user=admin password={{ glance_keystone_password }} role=admin region_name={{ openstack_region_name }} auth={{ '{{ openstack_glance_auth }}' }}" -e "{'openstack_glance_auth':{{ openstack_glance_auth }}}" register: glance_sanity changed_when: "{{ glance_sanity.stdout.find('localhost | SUCCESS => ') != -1 and (glance_sanity.stdout.split('localhost | SUCCESS => ')[1]|from_json).changed }}" until: glance_sanity.stdout.split()[2] == 'SUCCESS' retries: 10 delay: 5 when: kolla_enable_sanity_glance | bool

commit_message:
Change "--sort" description in help message

In Cinder server project, class ManageResource just supports
'size' and 'refrence' sort key. So change "--sort" description
in manageable-list and snapshot-manageable-list commands help
message.

Change-Id: Ie07bb73a9b9f2ef1a2a1e90834fcbe1f53cb562d
Closes-Bug: #1657988

commit_message:
Remove some comment for flavor plugin

We can remove the NOTE for versioned notification for flavor since
the related bug: https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/1653221 is
fixed.

Change-Id: I4187c807abd520ee64acd601a51708ab6dfc781e

commit_message:
Move dogtag plugin config options to extra file

This is useful to prepare the switch to use oslo-config-generator.
When using the generator, we then do not need to have all the dogtag
dependencies imported to while generating the sample config file.

Change-Id: I90870dcb49cd96f6bf0fe353fa6e779ffd87a5af
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/barbican refs/changes/81/437981/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # we want to keep the dogtag config options separated. That way we # do not need to import every dogtag requirement to generate the # sample config import barbican.plugin.dogtag_config_opts # noqa
deleted_lines: from oslo_config import cfgdogtag_plugin_group = cfg.OptGroup(name='dogtag_plugin', title="Dogtag Plugin Options") dogtag_plugin_opts = [ cfg.StrOpt('pem_path', help=u._('Path to PEM file for authentication')), cfg.StrOpt('dogtag_host', default="localhost", help=u._('Hostname for the Dogtag instance')), cfg.StrOpt('dogtag_port', default="8443", help=u._('Port for the Dogtag instance')), cfg.StrOpt('nss_db_path', help=u._('Path to the NSS certificate database')), cfg.StrOpt('nss_password', help=u._('Password for the NSS certificate databases'), secret=True), cfg.StrOpt('simple_cmc_profile', help=u._('Profile for simple CMC requests')), cfg.StrOpt('auto_approved_profiles', default="caServerCert", help=u._('List of automatically approved enrollment profiles')), cfg.StrOpt('ca_expiration_time', default=cm.CA_INFO_DEFAULT_EXPIRATION_DAYS, help=u._('Time in days for CA entries to expire')), cfg.StrOpt('plugin_working_dir', help=u._('Working directory for Dogtag plugin')), cfg.StrOpt('plugin_name', help=u._('User friendly plugin name'), default='Dogtag KRA'), ] CONF.register_group(dogtag_plugin_group) CONF.register_opts(dogtag_plugin_opts, group=dogtag_plugin_group) config.parse_args(CONF)

commit_message:
make doc job of jenkins executing successfully

gate-tripleo-incubator-docs-ubuntu-xenial always fail.
Because the job install docutils 0.13.1.
error messages is below
http://paste.openstack.org/show/602381/
related review is below
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/418772/
So modify test-requirment in order to install sphinx >= 1.5.1

Change-Id: I9f8998beef9bd1b5819596d7ef3a51a47ecf8972

commit_message:
define non_root_group explicitly

previously, we used set_fact to set the non_root_group variable but
this is problematic: the libvirt/ playbooks are expected to be
runnable *without* also running the provision/ playbooks, in which
case non_root_group is not set, causing ansible to fail.

this change makes non_root_group explicit and adds it to
roles/common/defaults/main.yml.

Change-Id: I5a174a303c980569fad31f7d7fa8e846105a2291
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-quickstart refs/changes/33/439133/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: non_root_group: "{{ non_root_user }}"

commit_message:
derive overcloud_public_ip

derive a default value for overcloud_public_ip from
undercloud_external_network_cidr.  This allows the deployer to set a
single value (undercloud_external_network_cidr) and have all the
defaults adjust accordingly.

Change-Id: Ideaec0e4036785e3c2f3d2859c85df827e624ca1
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-quickstart-extras refs/changes/69/441569/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: overcloud_public_vip: "{{ undercloud_external_network_cidr|nthhost(5) }}"

commit_message:
Use OpenStack-Infra MariaDB mirror in OpenStack-CI

When executing tests within OpenStack-CI, the MariaDB
mirror implemented in CopenStack-Infra will be used
instead of the Rackspace mirror.

This should speed up OpenStack-CI testing and be more
reliable as it eliminates external dependencies and
does not rely on a single mirror as a source.

For the sake of record, the MariaDB mirror was
implemented in OpenStack-Infra with these reviews:

- https://review.openstack.org/307831
- https://review.openstack.org/354203
- https://review.openstack.org/440769

Change-Id: I7254bc246525488f1b94a3835786307057a906c1
(cherry picked from commit daca9307bb7f8876a4a107a37a6b5225bcb758a8)

revisions:

repo [1] this very long list is way over the top and

Change-Id: I4a797e9cd473da1b7fea03b600fdb86ccac407b3

commit_message:
Cut down default lxc_cache_distro_packages

The current list of packages was the list built up for
Icehouse/Juno/Kilo/Liberty/Mitaka and has never been
cleared out.

As is evidenced by the test results in the integrated
repo [1] this very long list is way over the top and
completely unnecessary.

commit_message:
put mysql on a memory diet

We propose several MySQL configuration parameter changes (with
explanations) to reduce the memory footprint of MySQL. A demonstration
of the improvement is provided in
https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/change-438668.

As Clint provided some of the descriptions that I've used, I have
listed him as a co-author (thanks Clint). Let this serve as a warning
to all that commetors may be enlisted :)

Change-Id: Icb2d6ea91d3d45a68ce99c817a746b10039479cc
Co-Authored-By: Clint 'SpamapS' Byrum <clint@fewbar.com>

added_lines: # Additional settings to put MySQL on a memory diet iniset -sudo $my_conf binlog_cache_size 4K iniset -sudo $my_conf binlog_stmt_cache_size 4K iniset -sudo $my_conf bulk_insert_buffer_size 0 iniset -sudo $my_conf host_cache_size 0 iniset -sudo $my_conf innodb_buffer_pool_size 5M iniset -sudo $my_conf innodb_ft_cache_size 1600000 iniset -sudo $my_conf innodb_ft_total_cache_size 32000000 iniset -sudo $my_conf innodb_log_buffer_size 256K iniset -sudo $my_conf innodb_sort_buffer_size 64K iniset -sudo $my_conf join_buffer_size 128 iniset -sudo $my_conf key_buffer_size 8 iniset -sudo $my_conf max_heap_table_size 16K iniset -sudo $my_conf net_buffer_length 1K iniset -sudo $my_conf read_buffer_size 8200 iniset -sudo $my_conf read_rnd_buffer_size 8200 iniset -sudo $my_conf sort_buffer_size 32K iniset -sudo $my_conf thread_cache_size 0 iniset -sudo $my_conf thread_stack 131072 iniset -sudo $my_conf tmp_table_size 1K

commit_message:
[overcloud-deploy] Update deprecated references to Heat

The references to Heat command are deprecated from Mitaka release and we should
now be using the OpenStack CLI instead.

Change-Id: Ib05e65b81c25ec695c59b9d443df69814728f67a
Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud <gchamoul@redhat.com>

commit_message:
add missing skip case for extra environment for composable scenario

The recent commit omit to skip:
~/environments/deployed-server-bootstrap-environment-centos.yaml
when we are deploying a mixed version of tripleo
This commit add the skip of this file when the overcloud_release
variable is set is newton or mitaka

Change-Id: I8e6eb632c3391a93436e0361f2c0123796d06b36

commit_message:
api-ref: some quota APIs don't return 404

Some quota APIs don't return 404 even if wrong project_id is passed.
This is a correct behavior of quota API. In Nova api-ref, it's shown
as well[1].

[1]: https://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/compute/?expanded=#show-a-quota

Change-Id: Ib793593bff31eaf0c8d237cf374e5cbf8ae5f52b

commit_message:
Indicating the location tests directory in oslo_debug_helper

According to [1], we can passing a "-t" argument to
oslo_debug_helper to indicate the directory where tests
are located. This will solves ImportError exception.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslotest/features.html

Change-Id: Ifb290b00e79f9d5236d84163c13571dc74cea4e0
Closes-Bug: #1666560

commit_message:
Introduce userspace group_vars and host_vars

This opens the door to using group_vars and host_vars in
userspace, by allowing the user to define a ":" delimited list
of folder that will then be used by a vars_plugin, and (maybe
later) by the inventory.

This can't override group_vars due to ansible precedence.
We could technically have this override done by moving the
group_vars into a different folder and adding it to these
environment variables.

Change-Id: Ib2cbb35c0a7bccd896fbe71c22eeb07188db99ee
(cherry picked from commit 2377479d9bcc305f26040fabcc1d26d7f8b01915)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible refs/changes/98/445598/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: export ANSIBLE_VARS_PLUGINS="${ANSIBLE_VARS_PLUGINS:-/etc/ansible/roles/plugins/vars_plugins}"# Extra non-ansible default variables to use with vars_plugin. # Allow the usage of userspace group_vars host_vars with user # defined precedence until this behavior is merged in the # inventory export GROUP_VARS_PATH="${GROUP_VARS_PATH:-/etc/openstack_deploy/group_vars/}" export HOST_VARS_PATH="${HOST_VARS_PATH:-/etc/openstack_deploy/host_vars/}"

commit_message:
Made ironic-standalone -nv in check pipeline

Move ironic-standalone to check pipeline as non-voting.
When job is considered as stable enough made it voting and
remove current ironic jobs that do the same testing:

    wholedisk-bios-agent_ipmitool-tinyipa-ubuntu-xenial
    wholedisk-bios-pxe_ipmitool-tinyipa-ubuntu-xenial
    partition-bios-agent_ipmitool-tinyipa-ubuntu-xenial
    ipa-partition-bios-pxe_ipmitool-tinyipa-ubuntu-xenial

Depends-On: Ic04b0f134e20d9937a610a14d7c4128f45738eeb

Change-Id: I641c56c6494eb76aa5e790213b9821200e235bc7

commit_message:
Cleanup nova-placement installation

pkg installation is done in "nova_install_{{ ansible_pkg_mgr }}.yml"
so it doesn't need to be in nova_placement.yml

Change-Id: Ie0b627ed2d8625e8be91881cd00e0b220bd70128
(cherry picked from commit 6d1346bb85fbac2ba6af56837f01b65c8c674886)

commit_message:
Add policy-docs spec

We should ensure operators no longer need to read code to fully
understand what each of the policy rules means.

blueprint policy-docs

Change-Id: Ic855f1dc84389ed87a4e6a2adb53f1a8de762020
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova-specs refs/changes/10/433010/10 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ============== Add Polcy Docs ============== https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/policy-docs Today operators needs to read the code to work out what a policy rule actually means. That is terrible, and this spec proposes we fix that. Problem description =================== Operators need to read the code to understand what a policy rule controls. Use Cases --------- * Operator wants to audit the default policy rules and see if they are appropriate for their deployment. * Operator wants to give users access to a particular API that they current get a 403 error when accessing * Operator wants to restrict access to an API they currently have access to. Proposed change =============== We should fill in the description field for all of the policy rules in the system. To help ensure the operator doesn't need to read the code to fully understand the impact of each rule, we should ensure: * All docs should use the names of entities described in the API docs: http://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/compute/ * We should state the URL of the API the policy rule affects, in the same format as it appears int he api-ref, i.e.: DELETE /servers/{server_id} * The default access level should be described, covering both: Project or Global, Member vs Admin vs Anyone, Read vs Write * We should ensure the docs are rendered well in the generated policy file, including ensuring all the rules are commented out by default: http://docs.openstack.org/developer/nova/sample_policy.html For example, we might see something like this in the sample policy::: # Show details of a specific server # # GET /servers/{server_id} # Default access: Project, Member, Read # # "os_compute_api:servers:show": "rule:admin_or_owner" # Show the real hostname the nova-compute managing the server # # GET /servers/{server_id} # Default access: Project, Admin, Read # # "os_compute_api:servers:show:host_status": "rule:admin_api" # Create a server # # POST /servers/{server_id} # Default access: Project, Member, Write # # "os_compute_api:servers:create": "rule:admin_or_owner" # List all host aggregates # # GET /os-aggregates # Default access: Global, Admin, Read # # "os_compute_api:os-aggregates:index": "rule:admin_api" # Delete a host aggregate # # DELETE /os-aggregates/{aggregate_id} # Default access: Global, Admin, Read # # "os_compute_api:os-aggregates:delete": "rule:admin_api" # Show API version information # # GET / # Default access: Global, Anyone, read # # "os_compute_api:os-aggregates:delete": "rule:admin_api" Alternatives ------------ We could try documentation separate to the code, but that has proven hard to maintain and keep in sync with the code. Data model impact ----------------- None REST API impact --------------- None Security impact --------------- A better understanding of what each rule means can only help operators and developer get the policy configuration correct. Notifications impact -------------------- None Other end user impact --------------------- None Performance Impact ------------------ None Other deployer impact --------------------- None Developer impact ---------------- We must remember to add a description when adding a policy docs. Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Who is leading the writing of the code? Or is this a blueprint where you're throwing it out there to see who picks it up? If more than one person is working on the implementation, please designate the primary author and contact. Primary assignee: John Garbutt (johnthetubaguy) Other contributors: OSIC Work Items ---------- * Add docs for each policy rule * Ensure sample policy file renders correctly Dependencies ============ None Testing ======= None Documentation Impact ==================== We get a much improved sample policy file. We should explore getting this into the configuration guide for Nova. References ========== None History ======= .. list-table:: Revisions :header-rows: 1 * - Release Name - Description * - Pike - Introduced

commit_message:
oooq multinode: fix for stable branches

Current quickstart setup is not working with stable branches for the
multinode jobs.
Since we're still using the bootstrap script from tripleo.sh to
bootstrap nodes in multinode, we need to create and propagate deploy.env
to the subnodes.
We use existing functions, with some changes.

Partial-Bug: #1673051
Change-Id: Id05dcc64fcf7f67792400447a73ba179a9d4db4f

commit_message:
Devstack plugin: API only mode

devstack plugin should initialize at API-service mode for third party
vendor handlers, which do not use amphorae.

Change-Id: Ie41580565eb1a32c3d00c38c895ad3ac4e246049

commit_message:
add --no-show-source option to report command

Add a ``--no-show-source`` option to the report command to skip
including the note reference file names and SHA information in comments
in the output. This restores the previous format of the output for cases
where it is meant to be read by people directly, not just converted to
HTML.

Change-Id: Ie284b8a8e60d5a5f958d229c5972e8d9bf697d44
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
fix bytes/str handling when looking for file content

The tests were passing unicode but in some cases the real code was
passing bytes, so accept both and do the encoding ourselves if we need
to.

Change-Id: I0f64d301b36207b1ffa6503e8c27f679cdf6516f
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Add HAproxy to source installation packages

The latest release of OpenStack has moved a lot of the neutron
metadata proxy processes to use HAproxy instead.  This package
is not installed by default and causes builds to fail.

This patch addresses this issue by adding the HAproxy package
which should clear out gate problems for source installs.

Change-Id: I2e42828b1ccdb3a79b95bee85648d55508c0f2f9

added_lines: # Copyright 2017 AT&T Corporation. # All Rights Reserved. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. from tempest import config from tempest.lib.common.utils import data_utils from tempest.lib.common.utils import test_utils from tempest.lib import decorators from patrole_tempest_plugin import rbac_rule_validation from patrole_tempest_plugin.rbac_utils import rbac_utils from patrole_tempest_plugin.tests.api.compute import rbac_base CONF = config.CONF class QuotaSetsRbacTest(rbac_base.BaseV2ComputeRbacTest): @classmethod def setup_clients(cls): super(QuotaSetsRbacTest, cls).setup_clients() cls.client = cls.quotas_client cls.projects_client = cls.os.projects_client @classmethod def skip_checks(cls): super(QuotaSetsRbacTest, cls).skip_checks() if not CONF.compute_feature_enabled.api_extensions: raise cls.skipException( '%s skipped as no compute extensions enabled' % cls.__name__) @classmethod def resource_setup(cls): super(QuotaSetsRbacTest, cls).resource_setup() cls.tenant_id = cls.quotas_client.tenant_id cls.user_id = cls.quotas_client.user_id cls.quota_set = set(('injected_file_content_bytes', 'metadata_items', 'injected_files', 'ram', 'floating_ips', 'fixed_ips', 'key_pair', 'injected_file_path_bytes', 'instances', 'security_group_rules', 'cores', 'security_groups')) def tearDown(self): rbac_utils.switch_role(self, switchToRbacRole=False) super(QuotaSetsRbacTest, self).tearDown() @decorators.idempotent_id('8229ceb0-db6a-4a2c-99c2-de226905d8b6') @rbac_rule_validation.action( service="nova", rule="os_compute_api:os-quota-sets:update") def test_update_quota_set(self): default_quota_set = self.client.show_default_quota_set( self.tenant_id)['quota_set'] new_quota_set = {'injected_file_content_bytes': 20480} rbac_utils.switch_role(self, switchToRbacRole=True) self.client.update_quota_set(self.tenant_id, force=True, **new_quota_set)['quota_set'] self.addCleanup(self.client.update_quota_set, self.tenant_id, **default_quota_set) @decorators.idempotent_id('58df5613-8f3c-400a-8b4b-2bae624d05e9') @rbac_rule_validation.action( service="nova", rule="os_compute_api:os-quota-sets:defaults") def test_show_default_quota_set(self): rbac_utils.switch_role(self, switchToRbacRole=True) self.client.show_default_quota_set(self.tenant_id)['quota_set'] @decorators.idempotent_id('e8169ac4-c402-4864-894e-aba74e3a459c') @rbac_rule_validation.action( service="nova", rule="os_compute_api:os-quota-sets:show") def test_show_quota_set(self): rbac_utils.switch_role(self, switchToRbacRole=True) self.client.show_quota_set(self.tenant_id)['quota_set'] @decorators.idempotent_id('4e240644-bf61-4872-9c32-8289ee2fdbbd') @rbac_rule_validation.action( service="nova", rule="os_compute_api:os-quota-sets:delete") def test_delete_quota_set(self): project_name = data_utils.rand_name('project') project = self.projects_client.create_project(name=project_name) project_id = project['project']['id'] self.addCleanup(test_utils.call_and_ignore_notfound_exc, self.projects_client.delete_project, project_id) rbac_utils.switch_role(self, switchToRbacRole=True) self.client.delete_quota_set(project_id) @decorators.idempotent_id('ac9184b6-f3b3-4e17-a632-4b92c6500f86') @rbac_rule_validation.action( service="nova", rule="os_compute_api:os-quota-class-sets:detail") def test_show_quota_set_details(self): rbac_utils.switch_role(self, switchToRbacRole=True) self.client.show_quota_set_details(self.tenant_id) ['quota_set']

commit_message:
Introduce userspace group_vars and host_vars

This opens the door to using group_vars and host_vars in
userspace, by allowing the user to define a ":" delimited list
of folder that will then be used by a vars_plugin, and (maybe
later) by the inventory.

This can't override group_vars due to ansible precedence.
We could technically have this override done by moving the
group_vars into a different folder and adding it to these
environment variables.

Manual combined backport of:
  - https://review.openstack.org/#/c/445603
  - https://review.openstack.org/#/c/445447

Change-Id: Id22e82b01b08885a1c7b516818ca07e75f6d558f

WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. # See the License for the specific language governing permissions and # limitations under the License. from __future__ import (absolute_import, division, print_function) __metaclass__ = type import os try: from __main__ import display except ImportError: from ansible.utils.display import Display display = Display() from ansible.parsing.dataloader import DataLoader from ansible.utils.vars import merge_hash def vars_files_loading(folder, name, matched=False): """ Load files recursively and sort them """ files = [] try: candidates = [os.path.join(folder, f) for f in os.listdir(folder)] except OSError: return files for f in candidates: if os.path.basename(f) in [name, name + ".yml", name + ".yaml"] or matched: if os.path.isfile(f): files.append(f) elif os.path.isdir(f): files.extend(vars_files_loading(f, name, matched=True)) return sorted(files) class VarsModule(object): """ Loads variables for groups and/or hosts """ def __init__(self, inventory): """ constructor """ self.inventory = inventory self.inventory_basedir = inventory.basedir() self.grp_vars_string = os.environ.get( 'GROUP_VARS_PATH', '/etc/openstack_deploy/group_vars') self.grp_vars_folders = self.grp_vars_string.split(":") self.host_vars_string = os.environ.get( 'HOST_VARS_PATH', '/etc/openstack_deploy/host_vars') self.host_vars_folders = self.host_vars_string.split(":") def run(self, host, vault_password=None): """ This function is only used for backwards compatibility with ansible1. We don't need to handle this case. """ return {} def get_host_vars(self, host, vault_password=None): """ Get host specific variables. """ resulting_host_vars = {} var_files = [] for host_var_folder in self.host_vars_folders: var_files.extend(vars_files_loading(host_var_folder, host.name)) _dataloader = DataLoader() _dataloader.set_vault_password(vault_password) for filename in var_files: display.vvvvv( "Hostname {}: Loading var file {}".format(host.name, filename)) data = _dataloader.load_from_file(filename) if data is not None: resulting_host_vars = merge_hash(resulting_host_vars, data) return resulting_host_vars def get_group_vars(self, group, vault_password=None): """ Get group specific variables. """ resulting_group_vars = {} var_files = [] for grp_var_folder in self.grp_vars_folders: var_files.extend(vars_files_loading(grp_var_folder, group.name)) _dataloader = DataLoader() _dataloader.set_vault_password(vault_password) for filename in var_files: display.vvvvv( "Group {}: Loading var file {}".format(group.name, filename)) data = _dataloader.load_from_file(filename) if data is not None: resulting_group_vars = merge_hash(resulting_group_vars, data) return resulting_group_vars

commit_message:
Introduce userspace group_vars and host_vars

This opens the door to using group_vars and host_vars in
userspace, by allowing the user to define a ":" delimited list
of folder that will then be used by a vars_plugin, and (maybe
later) by the inventory.

This can't override group_vars due to ansible precedence.
We could technically have this override done by moving the
group_vars into a different folder and adding it to these
environment variables.

Manual combined backport of:
  - https://review.openstack.org/#/c/445603
  - https://review.openstack.org/#/c/445447

Change-Id: Id22e82b01b08885a1c7b516818ca07e75f6d558f
(cherry picked from commit 77bbd15bdb1d9131398e323b9e1200a258e11951)

commit_message:
Explicitly configure credentials used by ironic to access neutron and swift

Using keystone_authtoken credentials for this purpose is deprecated.

Also stop setting neutron API URL explicitly for it to be fetched
from the service catalog instead.

Also add missing manifest includes (all except for swift are already included
implicitly for backward compatibility in puppet-ironic).

Change-Id: I89ed5709cb3110848c5185d3596dfd9eaed823e2
Partial-Bug: #1661250

commit_message:
Fix rdo package installation

When using yum to install a local package it will fail to upgrade pkg, so we
set it to present instead, like we do in pip_install role.

https://github.com/openstack/openstack-ansible-pip_install/blob/master/tasks/pre_install_yum.yml#L20

Change-Id: Ib10740dd95014ff4b473148fa4f685cb8cf824a5

commit_message:
Rename vars/common.yml to vars/main.yml

The file vars/main.yml is automatically loaded
so by using this file name we're able to get
rid of the task that loads vars/common.yml which
is a small optimisation.

Change-Id: I11615c41043060718b833079f0df274d9dc644cf
(cherry picked from commit 847ffa8d1766c9785ce1a2a58490e772a2631740)

commit_message:
Update preseed file names for Ubuntu 16.04

Update the bash and python libraries to use the new preseed files
that are necessary to make Ubuntu 16.04.2 install without error.

Change-Id: I6792fb4a112578351aaa89f9e743900586a41c48

commit_message:
Fix the kernel version been deployed on VMs

Base on the http://packages.ubuntu.com/trusty/kernel/, the
linux-image-generic will install the 3.13.0.112.120 [amd64, i386]
kernel. leave it empty will do nothing to the kernel. this is
important when you deploy ubuntu 14.04.5 on VMs which use 4.4 rather
then 3.13.

Change-Id: I7984edaef5a65320ec3b10085646e8ad5c93f65d

commit_message:
Rename vars/common.yml to vars/main.yml

The file vars/main.yml is automatically loaded
so by using this file name we're able to get
rid of the task that loads vars/common.yml which
is a small optimisation.

subject: Add Constraints support
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-20 04:37:35.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cliff/commit/9b8bfebea1554bb36474d68f85fb4b6db8405fe5', 'message': "Add Constraints support

Adding constraints support to libraries is slightly more complex than
services as the libraries themselves are listed in upper-constraints.txt
which leads to errors that you can't install a specific version and a
constrained version.

This change adds constraints support by also adding a helper script to
edit the constraints to remove cliff.

Change-Id: Ifa5cc8446cfbfec0c8b48b293feb76ce66a34d92
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-12-22 03:04:32.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cliff/commit/89e36041c64a9a23e9445d24b80949258fba5eeb', 'message': "Add Constraints support

Adding constraints support to libraries is slightly more complex than
services as the libraries themselves are listed in upper-constraints.txt
which leads to errors that you can't install a specific version and a
constrained version.

This change adds constraints support by also adding a helper script to
edit the constraints to remove cliff and at the same time pull any required
libraries from git.

Also the egg name fro python-neutronclient is wrong resulting in
warnings in the logs[1] so correct that wheil re-writing the deps in
tox.ini

[1] http://logs.openstack.org/42/412742/1/check/gate-cliff-tox-neutronclient-tip-ubuntu-xenial/e1ce5c0/console.html#_2016-12-20_04_40_50_638986

Change-Id: Ifa5cc8446cfbfec0c8b48b293feb76ce66a34d92
"}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2016-12-22 04:18:34.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cliff/commit/5f0a4974e928ff0b7412c6e92fb0553f85963265', 'message': "Add Constraints support

Adding constraints support to libraries is slightly more complex than
services as the libraries themselves are listed in upper-constraints.txt
which leads to errors that you can't install a specific version and a
constrained version.

This change adds constraints support by also adding a helper script to
edit the constraints to remove cliff and at the same time pull any required
libraries from git.

Also the egg name fro python-neutronclient is wrong resulting in
warnings in the logs[1] so correct that wheil re-writing the deps in
tox.ini

commit_message:
Add Constraints support

Adding constraints support to libraries is slightly more complex than
services as the libraries themselves are listed in upper-constraints.txt
which leads to errors that you can't install a specific version and a
constrained version.

This change adds constraints support by also adding a helper script to
edit the constraints to remove cliff and at the same time pull any required
libraries from git.

Also the egg name fro python-neutronclient is wrong resulting in
warnings in the logs[1] so correct that wheil re-writing the deps in
tox.ini

[1] http://logs.openstack.org/42/412742/1/check/gate-cliff-tox-neutronclient-tip-ubuntu-xenial/e1ce5c0/console.html#_2016-12-20_04_40_50_638986

Change-Id: Ifa5cc8446cfbfec0c8b48b293feb76ce66a34d92

commit_message:
Remove git_dest var and extras folder

The barbican_git_dest variable is not used anywhere
and the extras folder is no longer necessary as
barbican is now implemented in the integrated
release.

Change-Id: I88437e1a07140c55d083a82f15f139d86284f716
(cherry picked from commit 99b7e4af832f8ef5c086772b31e850e2fd01bedf)

commit_message:
Make tempest execute by default

Although the role executes to install it, tempest itself will
not execute unless told to do so. As a deployer may want
tempest to install but not execute in the playbook we set
the role default to not execute, so we must make it execute
here.

Change-Id: I269b43200c0e8773b5c0c437f685f6a0a4cd4e5e
(cherry picked from commit 52579f21feb16aa049de83741e1b827867b11c6a)

commit_message:
Rename vars/common.yml to vars/main.yml

The file vars/main.yml is automatically loaded
so by using this file name we're able to get
rid of the task that loads vars/common.yml which
is a small optimisation.

commit_message:
Implement Cinder, Nova Placement and mistral logs for kibana

Nova placement api, cinder api, volume logs along with mistral logs
are missing from the filter which will allow elastic search to fetch it
from the fluentd

Fixes the issue

Change-Id: I7899ce6e010bfc6534a88f0a2117dc0a9e60c7c7
Closes-Bug: #1673002

commit_message:
Add reno conventions to developer documentation

We have a few undocumented keystone specific conventions for the
usage of release notes. We need to write this down so that they are
easy for new developers to find. This will also make our release
notes more consistent and easier to maintain.

Change-Id: Ibaaaaf7b9740ef88cf6b08d02b0f0cfd26df9d9a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone refs/changes/55/444955/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: The Keystone team uses `reno <https://docs.openstack.org/developer/reno/usage.html>`_ to generate release notes. These are important user-facing documents that must be included when a user or operator facing change is performed, like fixing a bug or implementing a feature. A release note should be included in the same patch the work is being performed. Release notes must also be easy to read, link back to appropriate documentation readers may need, and be easy to maintain. The following conventions are specific to Keystone's usage of release notes and help the team unsure all release notes fit those goals. Most release notes either describe bug fixes or announce support for new features, both of which are tracked using Launchpad. When creating a release note that communicates a bug fix, use the bug number in the name of the note: .. code-block:: bash $ reno new bug-1652012 Created new notes file in releasenotes/notes/bug-1652012-7c53b9702b10084d.yaml The body of the release note should clearly explain how the impact will affect users and operators. It should also detail why the change was necessary since how the change was implemented can be determined by looking into the commit. It should also contain a properly formatted link in reStructuredText that points back to the original bug report used to track the fix. This makes reading release notes easier because readers can get a quick summary of the change, and easily follow a link to more detail if the choose. .. code-block:: yaml --- fixes: - | [`bug 1652012 <https://bugs.launchpad.net/keystone/+bug/1652012>`_] Changes the token_model to return is_admin_project False if the attribute is not defined. Returning True for this has the potential to be dangerous and the given reason for keeping it True was strictly for backwards compatability. Release notes detailing feature work follow the same basic format, but instead of using the bug number in the name of the release note, use the blueprint URL slug used to track the feature work: .. code-block:: bash $ reno new bp-support-fizzbangs Created new notes file in releasenotes/notes/bp-support-fizzbangs-d8f6a3d81c2a465f.yaml Just like for release notes communicating bug fixes, release notes detailing feature work must contain a link back to the blueprint. Readers should be able to easily discover all patches that implement the feature, as well as find links to full specifications, and documentation. All of this is typically found in the blueprint registered in Launchpad. .. code-block:: yaml --- features: - > [`blueprint support-fizzbangs<https://blueprints.launchpad.net/keystone/+spec/support-fizzbangs>`_] Keystone now fully supports the usage of fizzbangs. In the rare case there is a release note that doesn't pertain to a bug or feature work, use a sensible slug and include any documentation relating to the note. We can iterate on the content and application of the release note in review.
deleted_lines: The Keystone team uses `reno <https://docs.openstack.org/developer/reno/usage.html>`_ to generate release notes. These are important user-facing documents that must be included when a user-facing change is performed. A release note should be included in the same patch the work is being performed.

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-15 14:24:53.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/main.yml', 'tasks/repo_pre_build.yml', 'tasks/repo_clone_git.yml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-repo_build/commit/7ea396c94d923fe788c196c88ab9471b9ed33887', 'message': 'Include git clone for packages in requirements

Currently if there is a package in requirements which
needs to be built from one of the git clones, it will
not work unless the related host group is populated.
This is due to the fact that the selective git clone
hinges on the host group population.

This patch adds an extra check for each git clone to
validate whether the package is in the requirements

Change-Id: Id121a1bcd91f688c8fab41de0b74b5b8196f8b44
Closes-Bug: #1671958
(cherry picked from commit 7331b821b4e2894a62bd22e7e47e87e04b7d7f71)

commit_message:
Include git clone for packages in requirements

Currently if there is a package in requirements which
needs to be built from one of the git clones, it will
not work unless the related host group is populated.
This is due to the fact that the selective git clone
hinges on the host group population.

This patch adds an extra check for each git clone to
validate whether the package is in the requirements
list too. If it is, then it will clone the git source
regardless of the host group population.

Change-Id: Id121a1bcd91f688c8fab41de0b74b5b8196f8b44
Closes-Bug: #1671958
(cherry picked from commit 7331b821b4e2894a62bd22e7e47e87e04b7d7f71)

commit_message:
Rename vars/common.yml to vars/main.yml

The file vars/main.yml is automatically loaded
so by using this file name we're able to get
rid of the task that loads vars/common.yml which
is a small optimisation.

Change-Id: I4e0a1b81c42a90b7cd28830f1c2e72c7bd62efaf
(cherry picked from commit 78d844a0084837ae73027ef1ba8e0301dd302ae9)

commit_message:
Replace six.iteritems() with .items()

1.As mentioned in [1], we should avoid using
six.iteritems to achieve iterators. We can
use dict.items instead, as it will return
iterators in PY3 as well. And dict.items/keys
will more readable. 2.In py2, the performance
about list should be negligible, see the link [2].
[1] https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Python3
[2] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-June/066391.html

Change-Id: I0c903ca9d566c89e4e0d6bd129dc1f7bc3e95db9
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-common refs/changes/88/408888/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: for k, v in net.Net.properties_schema.items() for k, v in port.Port.properties_schema.items() for k, v in subnet.Subnet.properties_schema.items()
deleted_lines: import six for k, v in six.iteritems(net.Net.properties_schema) for k, v in six.iteritems(port.Port.properties_schema) for k, v in six.iteritems(subnet.Subnet.properties_schema)

commit_message:
Nosec pickle usage

In an effort to clean up Cinder's Bandit run, issue B301: Pickle
library appears to be in use, has been nosec'd in this file. This
usage of Pickle is secure as long as the /etc/cinder directory has
proper permissions. We decided against blacklisting this Bandit
issue as Pickle usage should be carefully considered due to the
ability to run arbitrary code via Pickle.

Change-Id: I0e8c46398df608aaec433b5e9a5159311f38a11d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/38/433938/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # file permissions prevent unauthorized pickle modification live_migration_details = pickle.load(f) #nosec

commit_message:
Include git clone for packages in requirements

Currently if there is a package in requirements which
needs to be built from one of the git clones, it will
not work unless the related host group is populated.
This is due to the fact that the selective git clone
hinges on the host group population.

This patch adds an extra check for each git clone to
validate whether the package is in the requirements
list too. If it is, then it will clone the git source
regardless of the host group population.

Change-Id: Id121a1bcd91f688c8fab41de0b74b5b8196f8b44
Closes-Bug: #1671958
(cherry picked from commit 7331b821b4e2894a62bd22e7e47e87e04b7d7f71)

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-14 14:23:20.000000000', 'files': ['vars/redhat-7.yml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-lxc_hosts/commit/89fa00fae931a822ec928f0ba6b8750ff8cdaca0', 'message': 'CentOS: Ensure that GPG keys are imported

In the cache preparation process we copy the host's GPG
keys into the container, but we never import them.

This can result in the following error when trying to
execute the package installation later:

"You have enabled checking of packages via GPG keys. This
is a good thing. However, you do not have any GPG public
keys installed."

Change-Id: I971769e588014ebb814d8549966c9a0c9715155e
(cherry picked from commit bfc63bd0f14c3e165f526f53f86526adb26dada3)
'}]
commit_message:
CentOS: Ensure that GPG keys are imported

In the cache preparation process we copy the host's GPG
keys into the container, but we never import them.

This can result in the following error when trying to
execute the package installation later:

"You have enabled checking of packages via GPG keys. This
is a good thing. However, you do not have any GPG public
keys installed."

Change-Id: I971769e588014ebb814d8549966c9a0c9715155e
(cherry picked from commit bfc63bd0f14c3e165f526f53f86526adb26dada3)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-lxc_hosts refs/changes/13/445513/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: rpm --import /etc/pki/rpm-gpg/*

commit_message:
Except HttpError 404 dlt_lpar

When encountering a HttpError 404 during dlt_lpar, from either
closing the vterm or the delete operation. Removes the 404 exception
handling based on URI from the driver level.

Change-Id: I710725141857fed42f06abd886ce00f97dd4c8e2
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova-powervm refs/changes/31/444031/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from nova_powervm.virt.powervm.i18n import _LW # Ensure any vterms are closed. Will no-op otherwise. try: vterm.close_vterm(adapter, lpar_uuid) except pvm_exc.HttpError as e: if e.response and e.response.status == 404: LOG.warning(_LW('Received 404 response status closing vterm for' 'LPARID: %s'), lpar_uuid) else: LOG.error(_LE('Error closing vterm for LPARID: %s'), lpar_uuid) raise # Attempt to delete the VM.
deleted_lines: # Attempt to delete the VM. If delete fails because of vterm # we will close the vterm and try the delete again # Ensure any vterms are closed. Will no-op otherwise. vterm.close_vterm(adapter, lpar_uuid)

commit_message:
Add vagrantfile for AIO testing

This patch adds a vagrantfile which enables the build
of an All-In-One (AIO) using vagrant and virtualbox.

Change-Id: Ief7bcac92f06a5dab709639bf281f23c12b84e45
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible refs/changes/54/438254/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Vagrant.configure(2) do |config| config.vm.box = "ubuntu/xenial64" config.vm.provider "virtualbox" do |v| v.name = "OpenStack-Ansible_#{Time.now.getutc.to_i}" v.memory = 8192 v.cpus = 4 image_path = "#{ENV["HOME"]}/VirtualBox VMs/#{v.name}" image_name = 'ubuntu-xenial-16.04-cloudimg' # We clone the image to a resizable format v.customize [ "clonehd", "#{image_path}/#{image_name}.vmdk", "#{image_path}/#{image_name}.vdi", "--format", "VDI" ] # Then resize it to 60 GB v.customize [ "modifymedium", "disk", "#{image_path}/#{image_name}.vdi", "--resize", 60 * 1024 ] # Then attach it as the primary disk v.customize [ "storageattach", :id, "--storagectl", "SCSI Controller", "--port", "0", "--device", "0", "--type", "hdd", "--nonrotational", "on", "--medium", "#{image_path}/#{image_name}.vdi" ] # Then remove the original disk v.customize [ "closemedium", "disk", "#{image_path}/#{image_name}.vmdk", "--delete" ] # Now we can execute the build config.vm.provision "shell", inline: <<-SHELL sudo su - cd /vagrant ./scripts/gate-check-commit.sh SHELL end end

commit_message:
Make fencing action parameter optional.

We now only add an action parameter for fencing agents when one is
supplied, allowing Pacemaker to make appropriate decisions about the
action, itself.

Change-Id: I67e0a7bb6d8db75e00bd6d1a7db495aadcfc04a6
Partial-Bug: #1670687

commit_message:
Don't create keystone account for disabled service

If service is disabled, don't expect to create the corresponding
keystone account.

Change-Id: I007088862de1c8643eca3a6b9b313f0125b9b8d1

commit_message:
Use global_physnet_mtu config in newton templates

The Newton neutron.conf template was missing the snippet to
support configuration of the underlying physical network MTU.

Add this snippet based on the Mitaka template, and tweak the
Mitaka template to insert the snippet prior to the zeromq
section config.

Change-Id: If38c2e056df8215d717bd29b46ff2fa0d0c6024d
Closes-Bug: 1673161
(cherry picked from commit 4a99be6bf68675179c392f04c7f2ea2e650c497e)

commit_message:
Use global_physnet_mtu config in newton templates

The Newton neutron.conf template was missing the snippet to
support configuration of the underlying physical network MTU.

Add this snippet based on the Mitaka template, and tweak the
Mitaka template to insert the snippet prior to the zeromq
section config.

Change-Id: If38c2e056df8215d717bd29b46ff2fa0d0c6024d
Closes-Bug: 1673161

commit_message:
Revert "Adjust MTU to compensate for VLAN tag issue"

This reverts commit 4223b88b708e145c1dcdc38e4209ecc9029dd91f.

The underlying neutron bug with native ofctl interface was fixed in Newton.
We no longer need to dumb down deployment MTU to accommodate Neutron.

Related-Bug: #1622017
Related-Bug: #1621533

Change-Id: I9082c2d198a02ac3321488df67a66d336556d64c
(cherry picked from commit c54d323ac3c3a6f8fecfedf71d6d0446a2599e8c)

commit_message:
Make ServiceNetMap support custom network names

The rework to support custom roles moved the service net map
into a nested stack, but the logic it contains fails to consider
operators may override the network names via *NetName parameters.

So add a map_replace of the ServiceNetMapDefaults so we maintain
the existing default service->network assignments, even when the
network name is changed.

Note that operators will still be expected to pass any ServiceNetMap
overrides with the "new" network name, e.g whatever *NetName specifies,
otherwise I think environment files could get very confusing.

Change-Id: I52018e19428e11d26650f0ea6ccee3ae02494ff8
Partial-Bug: #1651541
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/25/413625/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Note the values in this map are replaced by *NetName # to allow for sane defaults when the network names are # overridden. InternalApiNetName: default: internal_api description: The name of the internal API network. type: string ExternalNetName: default: external description: The name of the external network. type: string ManagementNetName: default: management description: The name of the management network. type: string StorageNetName: default: storage description: The name of the storage network. type: string StorageMgmtNetName: default: storage_mgmt description: The name of the Storage management network. type: string TenantNetName: default: tenant description: The name of the tenant network. type: string resources: ServiceNetMapValue: type: OS::Heat::Value properties: type: json value: map_merge: - map_replace: - {get_param: ServiceNetMapDefaults} - values: external: {get_param: ExternalNetName} internal_api: {get_param: InternalApiNetName} storage: {get_param: StorageNetName} storage_mgmt: {get_param: StorageMgmtNetName} tenant: {get_param: TenantNetName} management: {get_param: ManagementNetName} - map_replace: - {get_param: ServiceNetMap} - keys: {get_param: ServiceNetMapDeprecatedMapping} value: {get_attr: [ServiceNetMapValue, value]} map: {get_attr: [ServiceNetMapValue, value]}
deleted_lines: value: map_merge: - {get_param: ServiceNetMapDefaults} - map_replace: - {get_param: ServiceNetMap} - keys: {get_param: ServiceNetMapDeprecatedMapping} map: map_merge: - {get_param: ServiceNetMapDefaults} - map_replace: - {get_param: ServiceNetMap} - keys: {get_param: ServiceNetMapDeprecatedMapping}

DEVICE_OWNER_ROUTER_SNAT) can match on l2pop_db.HA_ROUTER_PORTS[1],
but can not get any fdb entries by _get_ha_port_agents_fdb. Then,
the fdb_entries[network_id]['ports'] is been overwritten by {}. So
the associated flow entries will not be deleted.

Closes-Bug: #1668277

commit_message:
Change the way to distinguish the port type

In delete_port_postcommit, a DVR port (port['device_owner'] =
DEVICE_OWNER_ROUTER_SNAT) can match on l2pop_db.HA_ROUTER_PORTS[1],
but can not get any fdb entries by _get_ha_port_agents_fdb. Then,
the fdb_entries[network_id]['ports'] is been overwritten by {}. So
the associated flow entries will not be deleted.

Closes-Bug: #1668277
Change-Id: I7b621157fe85945acd99e4f08b6370d2f9c3d44d

commit_message:
Add some metadata logging to root cause ssh failure

Instances aren't getting SSH keys in some circumstances.
This adds a few debug statements to see if the Nova metadata
service thinks an instance has keys.

Related-Bug: #1668958
Change-Id: I3095d3024b62d5ebb4ea9e388a40ed94ef8f832b
